BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: AIR FORCE RETIRED OFFICERS COMMUNITY - WASHINGTON DC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FALCONS LANDING PROVIDES HOUSING AND SERVICES VIA A CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY TO RETIRED AND HONORABLY DISCHARGED MILITARY OFFICERS AND SENIOR RETIRED FEDERAL EMPLOYEES, THEIR SPOUSES AND WIDOWED SPOUSES
IRS990.MissionDesc: MISSION IS TO OPERATE A FIRST CLASS NOT FOR PROFIT CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY FOR THE BENEFIT OF RETIRED MILITARY OFFICERS AND SENIOR RETIRED FEDERAL EMPLOYEES THEIR SPOUSES AND WIDOWED SPOUSES AND HONORABLY DISCHARGED MIITARY OFFICERS WE SHALL PROVIDE FACILITIES AND SERVICES THAT SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE HEALTH SECURITY HAPPINESS AND
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE HOUSING FOOD AND OTHER SERVICES TO 412 INDEPENDENT LIVING RESIDENTS OF A RETIREMENT COMMUNITY

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PROVIDE HOUSING, NURSING, FOOD AND OTHER SERVICES TO 121 HEALTH CENTER RESIDENTS OF A RETIREMENT COMMUNITY

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: 13,638 HOURS OF RESIDENT VOLUNTEER HOURS TO THE COMMUNITY VALUED AT 364,818, INCLUDING THE AARP TAX AIDE PROGRAM, MEALS ON WHEELS, SUPPORT TO PUBLIC SCHOOL PROGRAMS SUCH AS HEAD START, HANDMADE TEDDY BEARS FOR THE FIRE RESCUE AND LOUDOUN HOSPITAL, SPECIAL OLYMPICS AND MANY OTHER PROGRAMS. 76,655 IN RESIDENT DONATIONS TO THE LOCAL FIRE RESCUE SQUAD. 22,200 OF DONATIONS BY THE RESIDENT CHAPEL COMMITTEE TO VARIOUS LOCAL CHARITIES. PROVIDED BALLROOM AND MEETING ROOM SPACE TO OUTSIDE NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND FOR OTHER COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES. AWARDED 75,000 IN SCHOLARSHIPS TO LOUDOUN COUNTY HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS

IRS990ScheduleA.FactsAndCircumstancesTestTxt: Part III Section B Line 12 Other income from Beauty Salon Guest meals Guest rooms Employee meals etc

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: Financial derivatives and other financial products

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FALCONS LANDING MAINTAINS AN ESCROW ACCOUNT FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE PLACED WAIT LIST AND RESERVATION AGREEMENT DEPOSITS PENDING THEIR MOVE IN THESE DEPOSITS ARE COMPLETELY REFUNDABLE AND ALL INTEREST ACCRUES TO THE INDIVIDUAL

A POLICY HAS BEEN DEVELOPED FOR THE USE OF BENEVOLENCE FUNDS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO RESIDENTS THE CFO RECEIVES REVIEWS AND VERIFIES REQUESTS FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THE REQUESTS ARE THEN FORWARDED TO THE BENEVOLENCE COMMITTEE AND THEN TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT AUTHORING OF LOUDOUN COUNT

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REDEEM SERIES B OF 2004 BOND ISSUE REDEEM SRIES 2014 BOND ISSUE

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE CFO THEN REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE AND AUDITOR AND PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THEIR REVIEW AND COMMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY REQUIRES A MANDATORY WRITTEN RESPONSE FROM ALL AFFECTED PARTIES DISCLOSING WHETHER THEY HAVE ANY OUTSIDE INTERESTS THAT WOULD JEPORDIZE THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES AT FALCONS LANDING IN THE EVENT OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST AFROC WILL TAKE ACTIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT/CEO INVOLVES A REVIEW OF COMPARABLE SALARIES IN THE INDUSTRY AND REQUIRES APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE BY CONTACTING THE FALCONS LANDING BUSINESS OFFICE
THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OVERSEES THE SELECTION OT THE AUDITORS AND THE AUDIT FINDINGS THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEARS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS DELEGATED AUTHORITY TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO MAKE ANY DECISIONS AS NECESSARY WITH A FOLLOWUP REPORT TO THE FULL BOARD AT THE NEXT BOARD MEETING THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF WILLIAM TIMME SCOTT CUSTER LAUREN LLOYD AND ED REODRIGUEZ ALL OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS ARE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
